title: Impossible News
description: If humans can change the orbit of a planet, other lifeforms have already been doing it. The following storyverse is based on controlling many moons - some in prograde others in retrograde orbit are used to transform gaseous planets into more useful forms.

title: The Solarverse
description: Stars emit a sphere of matter that quickly morphs into a disc shape. When planets are freshly accreted the minerals are spread evenly thru the crust. Planets without recent moons tidally lock (i.e. Mercury) with the Sun - resulting in hot and cold sides of the planet. The inner planets without moons acrete mostly heavier elements.

title: The Galactic Year
description: Galatic years last about 225 million Earth years - considering the ellipitical orbit of the Sun around the Milky Way Earth is in the same position as when Permian–Triassic extinction event hit 200 million years ago killing 57% of biological life, the cause being carbon dioxide emissions - Earth must once again prepare for new moons. This means ramping up rocket fuel production and advancing AI to track space objects. Once a galactic year the Copinerican System (our solar system) passes closest to the Milky Way black hole. This is when we can dump extra moons and need to fight off new arrivals.

title: Leaving Venus and arriving
description: Venus is still spinning retrograde today! Io defeated Ceres and used the planet to power migrating the Avians to Jupiter. Apollo blew up into pieces forming the asteroid belt and the retrograde moons around Saturn and Jupiter. Luna is our planet engineering tool, but at times she must go out and fight.

title: Spaceships orbit in the Kuiper Belt
description: A large body as a lead blocker at high speed absorbing small particle collisions is the only way to reliability survive system hopping.

title: We can already see some new visitors!
description: Usually the inner most planet of a solar system is consumed first, once it’s core is heated and used up, each successive planet is occupied.  These species are awaiting their turns.

title: Solar wind sails to retrograde spin Luna
description: The moon provides days and nights, tides and daily planet contortion. Luna reverses Earth's matgnetic field when deorbiting is required. notes https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Solar_maximum (11 years - reverses sun's magnetic field) sun storms - 3rd belt on van allen belt Magenetic energy obeys the law of conservation and builds up as the moon orbits. Gravity does not obey the law of conservation - it's force/energy creation is free. When the north pole reverses it releases the magnetic energy ejecting the moon from orbit.

title: Natural reactors function under different conditions in a planet core.
description: The core is a natural uranium reactor that runs until the U235 is exhausted. The fine-structure constant is effected in the dense core to to use only the amount of U235 needed. U235 half is greatly increased when not in veins due to the nucleus with of 585 barns. If there is too much U235 remaining and the planet gets to making veins too thick - it will blow up the like Planet Apollo did. The planet cores fuse matter creating U235 and other heavy elements emitting them evenly throughout their crust.

title: Solar wind provides backpressure and continually adds mass to the planets.
description: The solar wind makes it possible for atmospheres much more dense than planetational gravity can support. The planets grow slowly by accretion leading to a net gain in mass over time.
